description: The virtual machines resource usage dashboard displays resource usage measurements - disk usage ( I/O ) rates, CPU, memory, and ethernet interface Tx / Rx

links.title: Administration Portal: Virtual Machines
links.tooltip: The portal does not display deleted virtual machines

panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays resource usage (CPU, memory, ethernet interface Tx/Rx, disk I/O) for a selected virtual machines within a selected period.

panels.description: This report displays average CPU usage for a selected virtual machines within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR05-1 - This query returns for the chosen vm
-- the average CPU_Usage and CPU_Peak for the hour of day and day of week.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- CPU usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST ( num AS INT )
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saturday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num ,
            AVG ( CPU_Usage ) AS CPU_Usage
        FROM 
            (
                -- VMs average CPU usage 
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status, vm_id
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                    ) AS samples
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active vms only
                    samples.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                    AND samples.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query 
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- TR05-1 - This query returns for the chosen vm
-- the average CPU_Usage and CPU_Peak for the hour of day and day of week.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- CPU usage
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST ( num AS INT )
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saturday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END AS num ,
            AVG ( CPU_Usage ) AS CPU_Usage
        FROM 
            (
                -- VMs average CPU usage 
                SELECT
                    history_datetime AS time,
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
                    SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
                FROM
                    (
                            SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status, vm_id
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                            SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status, vm_id
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                            WHERE
                                history_datetime <
                                    (
                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                    )
                    ) AS hourly_daily
                WHERE
                    -- Here we filter by active vms only
                    hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                    AND hourly_daily.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                GROUP BY history_datetime
            ) AS sub_query 
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END
        ORDER BY
            CASE $period_id
                WHEN 1
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'D')
                WHEN 2
                    THEN TO_CHAR (time, 'HH24:00') 
            END ASC
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Average Memory Usage Peaks (TR05-4)
Virtual Machine Interface Rx and Tx Usage

panels.description: This report displays for the top 3 most utilized ethernet interfaces the average transmit rate for a selected virtual machine within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR05-5 - This query returns for the chosen vm,
-- for the top 3 most utilized ethernet interfaces,
-- the Rx_rate and Tx_rate, by the hour of day and day of week.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Tx_rate
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST ( num AS INT )
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saturday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    Tx_rate AS "Transmit Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            num,
            COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
            AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            (
                -- VMs ethernet interfaces Rx rate
                SELECT
                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                        ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS interface_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'D')
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'HH24:00') 
                    END AS num,
                    AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, transmit_rate_percent
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                    ) AS samples
                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                                samples.vm_interface_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- Here we get the latest vms interfaces configuration
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                            )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                        -- Here we get the top 3 utilised ethernet interfaces for the vm chosen by the user
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces c
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                c.vm_interface_id = 
                                                b.vm_interface_id
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    c.vm_interface_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT device_id
                                                FROM 
                                                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                    INNER JOIN
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id 
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                                    ) AS samples
                                                        ON 
                                                            (
                                                                samples.vm_configuration_version =
                                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                            )
                                                WHERE
                                                    -- Here we filter by active vm only
                                                    samples.vm_status = 1
                                                    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                                    AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                    AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                    -- Here we get the latest vms devices configuration
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                        IN 
                                                            (
                                                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                                GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                            )
                                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter        
                                                    AND
                                                        CASE
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                                THEN 1=1
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                                        END
                                            )
                                    AND b.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    -- Here we get the latest vms interface configuration
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                    GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
                                    ORDER BY
                                    AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                    AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                    DESC
                                LIMIT 3
                            )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
                    interface_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'D')
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'HH24:00') 
                    END
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')         
        GROUP BY num, interface_name
        ORDER BY num
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- TR05-5 - This query returns for the chosen vm,
-- for the top 3 most utilized ethernet interfaces,
-- the Rx_rate and Tx_rate, by the hour of day and day of week.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Tx_rate
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST ( num AS INT )
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saturday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    Tx_rate AS "Transmit Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            num,
            COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
            AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM 
            (
                -- VMs ethernet interfaces Rx rate
                SELECT
                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                        ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS interface_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'D')
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'HH24:00') 
                    END AS num,
                    AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
                FROM
                    (
                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, transmit_rate_percent
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, transmit_rate_percent
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                            WHERE
                                history_datetime <
                                    (
                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                    )
                    ) AS hourly_daily
                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                                hourly_daily.vm_interface_id
                            )

                    history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- Here we get the latest vms interfaces configuration
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                            )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                        -- Here we get the top 3 utilised ethernet interfaces for the vm chosen by the user
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                        UNION
                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent

                                                    )
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces c
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                c.vm_interface_id = 
                                                b.vm_interface_id
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    c.vm_interface_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT device_id
                                                FROM 
                                                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                    INNER JOIN
                                                    (
                                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id 
                                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                        UNION
                                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id
                                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                            WHERE
                                                                history_datetime <
                                                                    (
                                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                                    )
                                                    ) AS hourly_daily

                                                            (

                                                        IN 
                                                            (
                                                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                                GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                            )
                                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter        
                                                    AND
                                                        CASE
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                                THEN 1=1
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                                THEN delete_date isnull

                                    AND b.history_datetime < $__timeTo()

                                        IN 
                                            (

                                    GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id

                                    AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                    AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) )

                                LIMIT 3
                            )

panels.title: Top 3 Most Utilized Ethernet Interfaces - Transmit Rate (TR05-5)

panels.description: This report displays for the top 3 most utilized ethernet interfaces the average receive rate for a selected virtual machine within a selected period.

-- the Rx_rate and Tx_rate, by the hour of day and day of week.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Rx_rate

                                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose

panels.title: Top 3 Most Utilized Ethernet Interfaces - Receive Rate (TR05-6)

panels.description: This report displays for the top 5 most utilized disks the average read rate for a selected virtual machine within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- TR05-7 - This query returns for the chosen vm,
-- for the top 5 most utilized disks, the Read_Rate and Write_Rate
-- by the hour of day and day of week.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Read rate
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST ( num AS INT )
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saturday'
                END
        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    Read_Rate AS "Read Rate"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            num,
            COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
            AVG ( Read_Rate ) AS Read_Rate
        FROM 
            (
                -- VMs Disk Usage ( I/O ) Rates
                SELECT
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN vm_disk_name
                        ELSE vm_disk_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS disk_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'D')
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'HH24:00')
                    END AS num,
                    AVG ( CAST ( COALESCE ( read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS float ) / ( 1024 * 1024 ) ) AS Read_Rate
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_rate_bytes_per_second
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                    ) AS samples
                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                                samples.vm_disk_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- Here we get the latest vms disks configuration
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_disk_id
                            )
                    -- Here we get the top 5 utilised disks for the vm chosen by the user
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_rate_bytes_per_second, write_rate_bytes_per_second
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks c
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                c.vm_disk_id = 
                                                b.vm_disk_id
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    -- Here we filter by active vms disks only
                                    b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                    AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT device_id
                                                FROM 
                                                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                    INNER JOIN
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                                    ) AS samples_resources_usage
                                                        ON 
                                                            (
                                                                samples_resources_usage.vm_configuration_version =
                                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                            )
                                                WHERE
                                                    -- Here we filter by active vms only
                                                    samples_resources_usage.vm_status = 1
                                                    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                                    AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                    AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                    -- Here we get the latest vms devices configuration
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                        IN 
                                                            (
                                                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                                GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                            )
                                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                                    AND
                                                        CASE
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                                THEN 1=1
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                                    END
                                            )
                                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    -- Here we get the latest vms disks configuration
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                                ORDER BY
                                    AVG ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS float ) ) +
                                    AVG ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS float ) ) 
                                    DESC
                                LIMIT 5
                            )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    samples.vm_disk_id, 
                    disk_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR ( history_datetime, 'D' )
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR ( history_datetime, 'HH24:00' ) 
                    END
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
        WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')         
        GROUP BY num, disk_name
        ORDER BY
            num ASC,
            COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )
    ) AS all_sub_queries

-- TR05-7 - This query returns for the chosen vm,

                    (

                                        UNION

                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter

                                        CASE

                                                THEN 1=1

                                                THEN delete_date isnull

                                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id 
                                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                        UNION
                                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id
                                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                            WHERE
                                                                history_datetime <
                                                                    (
                                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                                    )
                                                    ) AS hourly_daily_resources_usage
                                                        ON 
                                                            (
                                                                hourly_daily_resources_usage.vm_configuration_version =
                                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                            )
                                                WHERE
                                                    -- Here we filter by active vms only
                                                    hourly_daily_resources_usage.vm_status = 1
                                                    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                                    AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                    AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                    -- Here we get the latest vms devices configuration
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                        IN 
                                                            (
                                                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                                GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                            )
                                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                                    AND
                                                        CASE
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                                THEN 1=1
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                                    END
                                            )
                                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    -- Here we get the latest vms disks configuration
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                                ORDER BY
                                    AVG ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.read_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS float ) ) +
                                    AVG ( CAST ( COALESCE ( b.write_rate_bytes_per_second, 0 ) AS float ) )
                                    DESC
                                LIMIT 5
                            )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    hourly_daily.vm_disk_id, 
                    disk_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'D')
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'HH24:00')
                    END
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY num, disk_name
        ORDER BY
            num ASC,
            COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Top 5 Most Utilized Disks - Write Rate (TR05-8)

panels.description: This report displays for the top 5 most utilized disks the average read operations per second for a selected virtual machine within a selected period.

-- TR05-9 - This query returns for the chosen vm,
-- for the top 5 most utilized disks, the Read_ops and Write_ops
-- by the hour of day and day of week.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Read ops
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    CASE $period_id
        WHEN 1 
            THEN 
                CASE CAST ( num AS INT )
                    WHEN 1 
                        THEN 'Sunday'
                    WHEN 2 
                        THEN 'Monday'
                    WHEN 3 
                        THEN 'Tuesday'
                    WHEN 4 
                        THEN 'Wednesday'
                    WHEN 5 
                        THEN'Thursday'
                    WHEN 6 
                        THEN 'Friday'
                    WHEN 7 
                        THEN 'Saturday'

        WHEN 2 
            THEN num

    Read_ops AS "Read ops"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            num,
            COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
            AVG ( Read_ops ) AS Read_ops
        FROM 
            (
                -- VMs Disk Usage ( I/O ) Rates
                SELECT
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN vm_disk_name
                        ELSE vm_disk_name

                    '*'

                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, read_ops_per_second

                            (
                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                                samples.vm_disk_id

                    history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- Here we get the latest vms disks configuration
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a

                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples

                                                c.vm_disk_id =

                                            )

                                    -- Here we filter by active vms disks only

                                                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices

                                                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples

                                                                samples_resources_usage.vm_configuration_version =

                                                    -- Here we filter by active vms only

                                                    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user

                                                            )
                                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose

                                                    AND
                                                        CASE
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                                THEN 1=1
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                                    END
                                            )
                                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()

                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'

                                GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id

    ) AS all_sub_queries

        WHEN 2 
            THEN num
    END AS num,
    Write_ops AS "Write ops"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            num,
            COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS disk_name,
            AVG ( Write_ops ) AS Write_ops
        FROM 
            (
                -- VMs Disk Usage ( I/O ) Rates
                SELECT
                    CASE
                        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                            THEN vm_disk_name
                        ELSE vm_disk_name
                    ||
                    '*'
                    END AS disk_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'D')
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'HH24:00')
                    END AS num,
                    AVG ( COALESCE ( write_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) AS Write_ops
                FROM
                    (
                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, write_ops_per_second
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, write_ops_per_second
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_daily
                            WHERE
                                history_datetime <
                                    (
                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                                    )
                    ) AS hourly_daily
                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                                hourly_daily.vm_disk_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- Here we get the latest vms disks configuration
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_disk_id
                            )
                    -- Here we get the top 5 utilised disks for the vm chosen by the user
                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks.vm_disk_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT c.vm_disk_id
                                FROM
                                    (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second 
                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                                        UNION
                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_disk_id, vm_disk_status, read_ops_per_second, write_ops_per_second 
                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_daily
                                            WHERE
                                                history_datetime <
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_hourly
                                                    )
                                    ) AS b
                                    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks c
                                        ON 
                                            (
                                                c.vm_disk_id = 
                                                b.vm_disk_id
                                            )
                                WHERE
                                    -- Here we filter by active vms disks only
                                    b.vm_disk_status = 1
                                    AND c.vm_disk_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT device_id
                                                FROM 
                                                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                                    INNER JOIN
                                                    (
                                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id 
                                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                        UNION
                                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status, vm_id
                                                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                            WHERE
                                                                history_datetime <
                                                                    (
                                                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                                    )
                                                    ) AS hourly_daily_resources_usage
                                                        ON 
                                                            (
                                                                hourly_daily_resources_usage.vm_configuration_version =
                                                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_configuration_version
                                                            )
                                                WHERE
                                                    -- Here we filter by active vms only
                                                    hourly_daily_resources_usage.vm_status = 1
                                                    -- Here we filter by the vm chosen by the user
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                                    AND create_date < $__timeTo()
                                                    AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                                    -- Here we get the latest vms devices configuration
                                                    AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.history_id 
                                                        IN 
                                                            (
                                                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices a
                                                                GROUP BY a.vm_id, a.device_id
                                                            )
                                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                                    AND
                                                        CASE
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                                THEN 1=1
                                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                                    END
                                            )
                                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                    -- Here we get the latest vms disks configuration
                                    AND c.history_id 
                                        IN 
                                            (
                                                SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                                FROM  v4_4_configuration_history_vms_disks AS d
                                                GROUP BY d.vm_disk_id
                                            )
                                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                                    AND
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                THEN 1=1
                                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                THEN delete_date isnull
                                        END
                                GROUP BY c.vm_disk_id
                                ORDER BY
                                    AVG ( COALESCE ( b.read_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) +
                                    AVG ( COALESCE ( b.write_ops_per_second, 0 ) ) 
                                    DESC
                                LIMIT 5
                            )
                    -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                    -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
                GROUP BY
                    hourly_daily.vm_disk_id, 
                    disk_name,
                    CASE $period_id
                        WHEN 1
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'D')
                        WHEN 2
                            THEN TO_CHAR (history_datetime, 'HH24:00')
                    END
            ) AS sub_query
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')        
        GROUP BY num, disk_name
        ORDER BY
            num ASC,
            COALESCE ( disk_name, MAX ( disk_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' )
    ) AS all_sub_queries

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN datacenter_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				
            ) 	 			
    AND datacenter_id  	         			    
        IN 			     				    
            ( 					 						
                SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters 					 						
                WHERE  					     						    
                    cluster_id 					         						        
                        IN 					             						            
                            ( 									 										
                                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms  								 									
                            ) 					
            ) 	 			
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END
